Sentence: Joel and Catherine, Mary's parents, are also waiting in their own house
Joel calls Mary to see if she (Mary) has heard any news, but she (Mary) has not
Joel takes Mary aside and gives her (Mary) the best advice he (Joel) can on how to cope with the death
He (Joel) tells her (Mary) to stay strong, and that he (Joel) has confidence in her (Mary)
Joel and Mary return to the living room, where Hannah, Catherine, and Andrew are all assembled
